title: MySQL WEEKDAY()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQL WEEKDAY()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the weekday number for a date:
SELECT WEEKDAY("2017-06-15");

Definition and Usage
The WEEKDAY() function returns the weekday number for a given date.
Note:
0 = Monday, 1 = Tuesday, 2 = Wednesday, 3 = Thursday, 
4 = Friday, 5 = Saturday, 6 = Sunday.
Syntax
WEEKDAY(
date
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
date
Required.  The date or datetime to extract the 
    weekday number from
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the weekday number for a date:
SELECT WEEKDAY("2017-01-01");

Example
Return the weekday number for the current system date:
SELECT WEEKDAY(CURDATE());

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQL WEEKDAY()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQL WEEKDAY()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQL WEEKDAY()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
